job_title: Student Services in San Diego, CA
pros: The campus is located close to freeway!
Good locations. I worked in Orange County.
cons: Claims about accreditation are cloudy. Trustees inexperienced.

review_title: Great work environment and learned a lot working here
job_title: Marketing Analyst/Marketing Manager in San Diego, CA
pros: I worked at Southern States University for two years and had a great experience. I learned a lot about the education industry, especially in terms of international students studying in the U.S. One of the great pros of working at this university was meeting students from dozens of different countries around the world, learning about new cultures and building relationships throughout the world. Management was easy to get along with and always was willing to hear out new ideas, and coworkers were very friendly and always willing to help. I would highly recommend working here if you are interested in learning about how small, private universities are run, as well as gain experience in various aspects of business.
cons: Only con I really dealt with were occasionally dealing with students who try to pull a fast one on the administration, who were sometimes a little difficult to deal with, although this will happen in any environment while dealing with students.

pros: Your day to day experiences can be very different keeping you on your toes and far from being bored. The campuses are filled with great students; you are able to meet people from all over the world building connections to them and learning about their cultures. Many position allow you to do many different types of tasks allowing personal growth and building resume experience. The employees who work here are also great and allow your place of work to be one you enjoy going to on a day to day basis.
cons: Office politics are always difficult to bear and there is no running away from it here. Just as in every other job, there can be upset students or customers that can be difficult to deal with. But it is all in a day's work.

pros: I worked here for 4 consecutive years and absolutely loved it. Great location, great facilities, high competence of the staff. Financially rewarding, excellent HR department. The working environment is tidy and quiet. Intellectually stimulating environment, and great student body.
cons: The only con I can think of is how shocked I am to read some of these negative reviews by ex-employees. I was an employee for 4 years and the funny thing is I can probably list the names of each bad reviewer. Unfortunately some people are always unhappy about everything!!! I really don't have any cons to list, I am so thankful for all the support I had throughout my journey at SSU and would definitely not had left if I didn't have to move out of state. Hopefully someone DEDICATED and PASSIONATE will take my spot rather than a disgruntled and ungrateful human being like the ones who commented poorly on here!

review_title: Great Opportunity to Learn and Contribute
job_title: Administrative Assistant in San Diego, CA
pros: This University is a great place to test your administrative abilities. There is always something to help solve or something to help plan. The staff and faculty is easy to get along with and most people do their tasks with timeliness and professionalism. Interacting with international students from around the world is also a great, humbling learning experience.
cons: Some cons to this job are dealing with disgruntled employees who seem to be very upset that they were let go from an awesome opportunity. At times, communication between campuses can get a bit clunky. There is also the rare occasion that a student is very disrespectful and treats staff and faculty with little empathy.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Newport Beach, CA
pros:
Great location , clean and safe environment. Close to John Wayne Airport, bus stops. Lots of free parking. 
Great student body from all over the world, dedicated faculty (minus some disgruntled who opted to write bad reviews). Students and employees work hard to guarantee student success. If you are dedicated and passionate about your job, this is a great place to work.
cons: Yes, some things need to be improved, which we are constantly working on. (IT network, class sizes)

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Diego, CA
pros: Lots of opportunities to learn the job in the education field. Small university with very good employees. In the process of achieving a larger accreditation and putting many great processes in place. I work for the San Diego Fashion Valley campus and love the location. Lots of parking. Nice students from all over the world.  Great faculty. Nice benefits paying 70% of health insurance. Lots of training.
cons: Follow regulation to the extreme. Students with low attendance are terminated and must to return to their home country.

job_title: English As A Second Language Teacher in San Diego, CA
pros: Started working here in the not too distant past and happy to have a job even though I can't stand the owner.  Some good people work there but they seem to want to get out as fast as possible, myself included.  Already working at another school part time so not worried if they read this review.
cons: Management is clueless.  I am an ESL teacher and am in awe at the mess.  Students are rude and barely awake.  Most students work illegally so "school" is just a way to maintain their visa.  Thus class is more baby sitting than teaching.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in San Diego, CA
pros: I never thought i could learn so much. The Staff are always ready to help, very polite, patient and do the best for the students. Everybody works hard and do their best. It is a good place to learn and improve your skills.
cons: I wish the students could appreciate more the staff work.

review_title: What a mess!  Conflicting information given to employees and teachers, no guidance, missing academic integrity.
job_title: English Instructor in San Diego, CA
pros: I guess that fact that it is located in San Diego which is an awesome city.
cons: Very little concern for quality in the classroom in both ESL and degree programs.   Students don't care, teachers don't care, and management doesn't care.   Basically this is a visa mill for international students pretending to be a university.

job_title: Campus Librarian in Las Vegas, NV
cons: Could not market to LV area.

job_title: ESL Instructor in San Diego, CA
cons: Outdated, slow computer system.  Very 'frugal' administration.
